PageTitle: active-route-advertise (BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view)
FuncDef:
The active-route-advertise command enables BGP to advertise only the selected routes in the IP routing table.
The undo active-route-advertise command restores the default setting. The active-route-advertise command enables BGP to advertise only the selected routes in the IP routing table. The undo active-route-advertise command restores the default setting. By default, BGP advertises all selected routes in the BGP routing table to peers. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view,BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv6 address family view
ExtraInfo: By default, BGP advertises all selected routes in the BGP routing table to peers. After the active-route-advertise command is configured, only the routes selected by BGP and also active at the routing management layer are advertised to peers.
